question: Who was elected as the 15th President of India?
solution:
Droupadi Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India and assumed office on 25 July 2022, becoming the first tribal person and second woman to hold the position. She defeated Yashwant Sinha, the opposition candidate backed by the UPA, securing 03% of the electoral vote.

The office of the President is located at Rashtrapati Bhavan, New Delhi, and was established on 26 January 1950, the day India became a republic.

The President is part of the Union Executive, governed under Part V of the Constitution, specifically Articles 52 to 62.

  • Article 52: There shall be a President of India.
  • Article 53: Executive power of the Union vests in the President.
  • Article 54–55: Election process.
  • Article 56–57: Term and eligibility for re-election.
  • Article 58–59: Qualifications and conditions of office.
  • Article 60–61: Oath and impeachment procedure.
  • Article 62: Election to fill vacancy.

She succeeded Ram Nath Kovind, the 14th President. The first President of India was Dr. Rajendra Prasad, who served from 1950 to 1962.

A notable fact: Droupadi Murmu is also the first President born after Independence.

Powers of the President of India:

  • Executive Powers: Appoints Prime Minister, Governors, Judges, and other key officials; administers Union Territories.
  • Legislative Powers: Summons, prorogues, and dissolves Parliament; gives assent to bills; can issue ordinances.
  • Judicial Powers: Can grant pardons, reprieves, and commute sentences under Article 72.
  • Military Powers: Supreme Commander of Armed Forces; appoints service chiefs; can declare war or peace
  • Emergency Powers: Can declare National Emergency (Art. 352), President’s Rule (Art. 356), and Financial Emergency (Art. 360).

question: Who was elected as the 14th Vice President of India?
solution:
Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the 14th Vice President of India on 6 August 2022 and took office on 11 August 2022. He succeeded M. Venkaiah Naidu.

The Vice President of India is governed under Part V, Chapter I of the Constitution, specifically Article 63 to Article 71.

  • Article 63: There shall be a Vice President of India.
  • Article 64: Vice President shall be ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.
  • Article 65: Can act as President in certain conditions.

The first Vice President of India was Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, who held office from 1952 to 1962.

Key Powers of Vice President:

  • Presides over proceedings of Rajya Sabha.
  • Acts as President in case of vacancy.
  • Elected by members of both Houses of Parliament.
  • Not part of the Union Executive, unlike the President.

question: Who was sworn in as the Prime Minister of India for the third consecutive term in June 2024?
solution:
Narendra Modi was sworn in as the Prime Minister of India for the third consecutive term on 9 June 2024, following a decisive victory in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. His first term began on 26 May 2014, making him the 14th Prime Minister of India and the first PM born after Independence.

The Prime Minister's role is defined under Part V, Chapter I of the Indian Constitution, specifically Articles 74 to 78:

  • Article 74: Council of Ministers to aid and advise the President
  • Article 75: Appointment, tenure, and responsibilities of the Prime Minister
  • Article 78: Duties of the Prime Minister to communicate with the President
  • The headquarters of the Prime Minister is located at South Block, Raisina Hill, New Delhi, India. The office was formally established on 15 August 1947, with Jawaharlal Nehru as the first Prime Minister of India.
  • Narendra Modi succeeded Dr. Manmohan Singh, who served from 2004 to 2014.
  • Current Affairs Fact: In July 2025, PM Modi became the first Indian Prime Minister in 57 years to make a State Visit to Brazil, where he was conferred Brazil’s highest civilian honour, the Grand Collar of the National Order of the Southern Cross.

question: Who was appointed as the Cabinet Secretary of India in August 2024?
solution:
T.V. Somanathan, a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Tamil Nadu cadre, was appointed as the Cabinet Secretary of India on 30 August 2024, succeeding Rajiv Gauba. He was previously serving as the Finance Secretary and has held key positions in the Prime Minister’s Office and Ministry of Corporate Affairs.

  • The Cabinet Secretary functions directly under the Prime Minister and is the ex-officio Chairman of the Civil Services Board.
  • The position was formally established on 6 February 1950, with N.R. Pillai as the first Cabinet Secretary of India.

Current Affairs Fact: As Finance Secretary, Somanathan played a key role in managing Atmanirbhar Bharat and PM Garib Kalyan Yojana, and was instrumental in shaping Production Linked Incentive (PLI) schemes.

question: Who was appointed as the Foreign Secretary of India in July 2024?
solution:
Vikram Misri, a 1989-batch Indian Foreign Service officer, was appointed as the 35th Foreign Secretary of India on 15 July 2024, succeeding Vinay Mohan Kwatra. He previously served as Deputy National Security Advisor and was India’s Ambassador to China during the 2020–21 border tensions.

Current Affairs Fact: In May 2025, Vikram Misri led a diplomatic mission to the United States and United Nations, submitting a dossier that helped designate The Resistance Front (TRF) as a global terror group, marking a major counterterrorism success for India.

question: Who is the current Home Secretary of India as of July 2025?
solution:
Govind Mohan, a 1989-batch IAS officer of the Sikkim cadre, is serving as the Home Secretary of India as of July 2025. He was appointed on 22 August 2024, succeeding Ajay Kumar Bhalla, who completed a five-year tenure.

His appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet, and in July 2025, his tenure was extended until 22 August 2026 to ensure continuity in sensitive national operations.

Current Affairs Fact: Govind Mohan previously headed the Ministry of Culture, where he oversaw key heritage digitization initiatives before taking charge of internal security affairs.

question: Who is the current Defence Secretary of India as of July 2025?
solution: Rajesh Kumar Singh, a 1989-batch IAS officer of the Kerala cadre, was appointed as the 40th Defence Secretary of India on 1 November 2024, succeeding Giridhar Aramane. Prior to this, he served as Secretary in the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) and also held key roles in the Ministry of Animal Husbandry & Dairying and the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas.

question: Who was appointed as the Finance Secretary of India in April 2025?
solution:
Ajay Seth, a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Karnataka cadre, was appointed as the Finance Secretary of India on April 2025, succeeding Tuhin Kanta Pandey, who became the Chairperson of SEBI.

Ajay Seth played a pivotal role in India’s fiscal consolidation during the pandemic years and was instrumental in launching India’s first sovereign green bonds. Under his leadership, the fiscal deficit reduced from 3% in FY21 to 4.8% in FY25.

question: Who was appointed as the Revenue Secretary of India in April 2025?
solution: Arvind Shrivastava, a 1994-batch IAS officer of the Karnataka cadre, was appointed as the Revenue Secretary of India by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet on 18 April 2025, and officially took charge on 1 May 2025. He succeeded Ajay Seth, who held the position in an interim capacity after Tuhin Kanta Pandey was appointed Chairperson of SEBI.

question: Who is the current Commerce Secretary of India as of July 2025?
solution:
Sunil Barthwal, a 1989-batch IAS officer of the Bihar cadre, has been serving as the Commerce Secretary of India since 30 September 2022, succeeding B.V.R. Subrahmanyam. Prior to this, he held the post of Labour & Employment Secretary, and is known for his reform work in the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO).

In April 2025, Sunil Barthwal led a high-level delegation to the Netherlands, where he initiated talks to establish a Green and Digital Corridor between Indian ports and the Port of Rotterdam, aiming to boost maritime trade and green hydrogen exports.

question: Who was appointed as the 15th Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) of India in November 2024?
solution:
K. Sanjay Murthy, a 1989-batch IAS officer of the Himachal Pradesh cadre, was appointed as the 15th Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) of India on 21 November 2024, succeeding Girish Chandra Murmu.

The office of the CAG is governed under Part V, Chapter V of the Indian Constitution, specifically Articles 148 to 151:

  • Article 148: Establishes the office of the CAG
  • Article 149: Empowers Parliament to define duties and powers
  • Article 150: Prescribes the form of accounts
  • Article 151: Submission of audit reports to the President/Governor
  • The first CAG of independent India was V. Narahari Rao, who served from 1948 to 1954.

Before becoming CAG, K. Sanjay Murthy served as Secretary of Higher Education, where he played a pivotal role in implementing the National Education Policy 2020 and led digital reforms in university governance.

question: Who was appointed as the 28th Controller General of Accounts (CGA) of India in March 2023?
solution:
Shyam S. Dubey, a 1989-batch officer of the Indian Civil Accounts Service (ICAS), was appointed as the 28th Controller General of Accounts (CGA) on 6 March 2023, succeeding Bharati Das, the 27th CGA and the first woman to hold the post.

The CGA’s role is governed under Part V, Chapter V of the Indian Constitution, specifically Articles 148 to 151:

  • Article 148: Establishes the office of the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG), with whom CGA coordinates
  • Article 149–151: Define audit duties, reporting formats, and submission protocols that CGA supports through financial data and internal audits

The first CGA of India was C. S. Swaminathan, appointed in 1976.

Current Affairs Fact: In March 2025, Shyam S. Dubey launched the e-Asset module of PFMS-SAMPATI, enabling digital tracking of capital assets, and highlighted PFMS’s role in transferring over ₹22.85 lakh crore during the pandemic.

question: Who is the current Chief Statistician of India as of July 2025?
option_4: Prof. Rajeev Laxman Karandikar
solution:
Prof. Rajeev Laxman Karandikar, a renowned mathematician and statistician, was appointed as the Chief Statistician of India and Chairman of the National Statistical Commission (NSC) in January 2023. He succeeded G.P. Samanta, and continues to serve as Professor Emeritus at Chennai Mathematical Institute (CMI).

The position is governed under Part V of the Constitution, and linked to statistical coordination and advisory functions through the National Statistical Commission, an autonomous body established in 2005.

question: Who is serving as the 16th Attorney General of India as of July 2025?
solution:
R. Venkataramani, a senior advocate and constitutional expert, was appointed as the 16th Attorney General of India on 1 October 2022, succeeding K.K. Venugopal. He was appointed by the President of India for a three-year term.

The office of the Attorney General is defined under Article 76 of the Indian Constitution (Part V).

Relevant Constitutional Articles:

  • Article 76: Establishes the post of Attorney General; appointed by the President
  • Article 88: Right to speak and participate in Parliament proceedings (no voting rights)
  • Article 105: Grants privileges and immunities similar to Members of Parliament.

Key Powers & Duties:

  • Chief legal advisor to the Government of India
  • Represents the Union in Supreme Court and High Courts
  • Can appear in any court across India
  • Advises on legal matters referred by the President
  • Participates in Parliamentary debates, but cannot vote
  • Not a government servant; can practice privately, but not against the government

First Attorney General of India:M.C. Setalvad (1950–1963); longest-serving AG and a key figure in shaping post-independence legal framework

question: Who is the current Solicitor General of India as of July 2025?
solution:
Tushar Mehta, a senior advocate, is serving as the Solicitor General of India since 10 October 2018. He was reappointed for a fresh three-year term starting 1 July 2023, making him the second-longest serving Solicitor General after C.K. Daphtary.

The post of Solicitor General is governed by the Law Officers (Conditions of Service) Rules, 1987, and is a statutory position, not a constitutional one.

Relevant Constitutional Linkages:

  • Article 76: Establishes the Attorney General (not SG directly, but SG assists AG)
  • Article 309: Empowers creation of service rules for law officers

Key Powers & Duties:

  • Assists the Attorney General in legal matters
  • Represents the Government of India in Supreme Court and High Courts
  • Advises on legal issues referred by the government
  • Cannot appear against the government or defend criminal cases without permission
  • Appointed by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC)

First Solicitor General of India:

  • C.K. Daphtary (1950–1963); later became Attorney General

question: Who is serving as the 52nd Chief Justice of India as of July 2025?
solution:
Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, popularly known as BR Gavai, was sworn in as the 52nd Chief Justice of India on 14 May 2025, succeeding Justice Sanjiv Khanna. He is the first Buddhist and second Dalit to hold this prestigious post, after Justice KG Balakrishnan.

His appointment was made by the President of India under Article 124(2) of the Constitution, which empowers the President to appoint judges of the Supreme Court, including the Chief Justice.

  • Heads the Supreme Court of India
  • Upholds the Constitution and Fundamental Rights
  • Has power to issue writs (5 writs) under Article 32 to protect rights (High court power to issue writs under Article 226)

Relevant Constitutional Articles:

  • Article 124(2): Appointment of Supreme Court judges by the President
  • Article 145: Powers of the Chief Justice to allocate cases and form benches
  • Article 147: Interpretation of the Constitution by the Supreme Court

First Chief Justice of India:

  • Harilal Jekisundas Kania, appointed on 26 January 1950

Current Affairs Fact: Justice Gavai has authored key judgments on Electoral Bonds, Article 370, and bulldozer demolitions, and is known for his strong stance on judicial dignity and constitutional values.

question: Who is serving as the Chairman of Lokpal of India as of July 2025?
solution:
Justice Ajay Manikrao Khanwilkar, former Supreme Court judge, was appointed as the Chairperson of Lokpal of India on 10 March 2024, succeeding Justice Pradip Kumar Mohanty, who held the post in an acting capacity after the retirement of Justice Pinaki Chandra Ghose in May 2022.

He is the second Lokpal of India, and his appointment was made by the President of India following recommendations from a high-level Selection Committee comprising the Prime Minister, Chief Justice of India, Speaker of Lok Sabha, Leader of Opposition, and an eminent jurist.

The Lokpal is a statutory body, established under the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act, 2013, not a constitutional one.

Inquires into corruption allegations against public functionaries

Covers PM, Ministers, MPs, and Group A–D officials, plus heads of NGOs receiving foreign funds above ₹10 lakh

First Lokpal of India: Justice Pinaki Chandra Ghose (2019 – 2022)

General Anil Chauhan (Retired) was appointed as the 2nd Chief of Defence Staff (CDS)

The CDS also serves as the Permanent Chairman of the Chiefs of Staff Committee

question: Who assumed office as the 26th Chief of the Naval Staff of India in April 2024?
solution: Admiral Dinesh Kumar Tripathi took charge as the 26th Chief of the Naval Staff on 30th April 2024, succeeding Admiral R. Hari Kumar. He previously served as the Vice Chief of Naval Staff and held several strategic assignments including Fleet Operations and Personnel. The Indian Navy, operating under the Ministry of Defence, was founded in 1612 under the East India Company but formally evolved post-independence. Its motto “Shano Varuna” reflects respect for the Lord of the Sea.

question: Who was appointed as the 28th Chief of the Air Staff of India in April 2024?
option_1: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh
option_2: Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari
option_3: Air Chief Marshal Arjan Singh
option_4: Air Chief Marshal RKS Bhadauria
solution: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh assumed office as the 28th Chief of the Air Staff on 30th April 2024, succeeding Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari. He previously served as the Vice Chief of Air Staff and has held key operational roles including commanding a frontline airbase. The Indian Air Force functions under the Ministry of Defence, and its establishment dates back to 8th October 1932 during British rule. The IAF motto “Nabha Sparsham Deeptam” is taken from the Bhagavad Gita, meaning “Touch the Sky with Glory”.

question: Who assumed charge as the 30th Chief of Army Staff of India in June 2024?
option_3: General M. M. Naravane
solution: General Upendra Dwivedi took over as the 30th Chief of Army Staff on 30th June 2024, succeeding General Manoj Pande. Prior to this, he served as the Vice Chief of Army Staff and has led critical commands including Northern Command which oversees operations along the borders with Pakistan and China. The Indian Army functions under the Ministry of Defence, and was officially established on 15th August 1947, though its origins trace back to the colonial era. The Army’s motto “Service Before Self” reflects its ethos of national service and sacrifice.

question: Who was appointed as the Director General of the Border Security Force (BSF) in June 2024?
solution: Daljit Singh Chawdhary was appointed as the Director General of the Border Security Force (BSF) on 18th June 2024, succeeding Nitin Agrawal. He is a 1990-batch IPS officer of Uttar Pradesh cadre known for his operational experience and leadership roles in paramilitary forces. The BSF, India’s first line of defense along the borders, operates under the Ministry of Home Affairs and was established in 1965 post the Indo-Pak war. BSF is responsible for guarding India’s borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh and also plays a significant role in anti-naxal and counter-insurgency operations.

question: Who was appointed as the 26th Chief Election Commissioner of India in February 2025?
solution:
Gyanesh Kumar, a 1988-batch IAS officer from the Kerala cadre, was appointed as the 26th Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) of India on 19th February 2025, succeeding Rajiv Kumar. He had earlier served as Election Commissioner from 15th March 2024 to 18th February 2025, and held key positions in the Ministry of Home Affairs, Parliamentary Affairs, and Cooperation.

The Election Commission of India is a constitutional body established under Article 324 of the Indian Constitution. The CEC is appointed by the President of India based on the recommendation of a three-member committee comprising the Prime Minister, Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, and a Union Cabinet Minister.

As per the CEC and Other ECs (Appointment, Conditions of Service and Term of Office) Act, 2023, the tenure of the CEC is six years or until the age of 65, whichever is earlier. Removal requires a two-thirds majority in both Houses of Parliament, similar to the process for a Supreme Court judge.

question: Who is serving as the Chairperson of the National Medical Commission (NMC) of India as of July 2025?

• The NMC is a statutory body established under the National Medical Commission Act, 2019, replacing the Medical Council of India (MCI)

question: Who is serving as the Central Vigilance Commissioner (CVC) of India as of July 2025?

question: Who is serving as the Chairperson of the Competition Commission of India (CCI) as of July 2025?
solution:

question: Who is serving as the Chairman of the 16th Finance Commission of India as of July 2025?

question: Who is serving as the Chairperson of the 23rd Law Commission of India as of July 2025?

• The 23rd Law Commission was formally constituted on 1st September 2024, with a tenure extending till 31st August 2027

• The Commission is a non-statutory body under the Ministry of Law and Justice, headquartered in New Delhi

question: Who is serving as the Director of the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre (VSSC) as of July 2025?

question: Who is serving as the Chairman of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) of India as of July 2025?

• He succeeded G. Satheesh Reddy, who became the Scientific Adviser to Raksha Mantri

• His tenure has been extended twice, most recently till 31st May 2026, by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet

• He holds a Ph.D. in Materials Science and Engineering from The Ohio State University, USA, and joined DRDO in 1989

• He has led major programmes in stealth materials, naval systems, aero engine alloys, and armour technologies

• DRDO is a defence R&D agency under the Ministry of Defence, headquartered in New Delhi, and was established in 1958

question: Who is serving as the Director General of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) as of July 2025?
solution:

• ICMR is a statutory body under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, headquartered in New Delhi

• Established in 1911
